greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest infinite sequence such that a(i) = a(j) => A002487(i) = A002487(j) and A323901(i) = A323901(j) for all i, j.
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of the ordered pair [A002487(n), A002487(A163511(n))].
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..65537
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences related to Stern's sequences
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
xref: Differs from A331745 for the first time at n=77, where a(77) = 40, while A331745(77) = 24.
Differs from A103391(1+n) for the first time at n=191, where a(191) = 23, while A103391(192) = 97.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 05 2020
